intro: Platysace eatoniae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing herb, often forming dense mats or clumps. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
